control.title: Level of control
control.content: Iroco has root control over the servers. Iroco does not have control over the network infrastructure used to route traffic to the servers.

topology.title: Topology
topology.content:
At present, the topology is simple because Iroco has two servers:
  • a production server at Éolas
  • a preproduction server at OVH.

infrastructure.title: Type of infrastructure
infrastructure.content:
Iroco servers are VPS :
  • production: VMware
  • preproduction: OpenStack Nova

hardware.title: Hardware
hardware.content:
• production : Intel(R) Xeon(R) Gold 6126 CPU @ 2.60GHz
  • preproduction : OVH VPS vps2020-essential-2-4-80 Intel Core Processor (Haswell, no TSX) 2,3 GHz

software.title: Software
software.content:
Iroco services run entirely on open-source software. Apart from the VMware virtualisation layer in production:
  • Operation system : Debian
  • SMTP Server: Postfix
  • IMAP Server, calendars/contacts : Cyrus
  • Web server: Nginx

security.title: Security
security.content: The mail server is protected by the fail2ban intrusion detector. Fail2ban is linked to the AbuseIPDB website, which indicates malicious IP addresses on the Internet. Our servers then download the list to update our firewalls.

audits.title: Audits
audits.content: You can find various audits of the site carried out with frago. We have initiated an accessibility audit following the RGAA (WCAG) criteria. You can follow the improvements to the site's accessibility on the audits.iroco.co pages. We will also be adding the RGESN (green IT) audit in the near future.

deploy.title: Deployment
deploy.content: Our deployment system is based on Ansible.

backup.title: Backups
backup.content:
Eolas handles the backups of our production server:
  • a full daily backup of the VM
  • several differential data backups per day
These backups are located in the Grenoble service centres.

iroco.title: Open source and trustworthy email
iroco.p: Opensource email which cares about your privacy. Developed and hosted in France.

client.title: Email the way you like it
client.p: Use our email with your favorite email client, on desktop and mobile. 30-day free trial.

respect.title: Committed to our values
respect.p: We use email everyday. Choose an inbox that's in line with what you believe in.

services.title: All the features you need
services.p: Easily manage you email, contacts and calendars thanks to CalDAV and CardDAV standards.

innovation.title: Contributing to digital commons
innovation.p: We believe in an open, transparent and user-friendly digital world. We proudly contribute to digital commons and work tirelessly to improve the security, environmental footprint and user experience of our services.

inclusive.title: Email for you and with you
inclusive.p: We want to offer useful and inclusive digital tools. If you have questions to ask or feedback to provide, we're open!

beginning.title: Why do we need trustworthy email?
beginning.p: We send and receive email everyday - serious email, light and fun email, and sometimes really important email. We entrust our inbox with a lot of information although we don't always know who has access to it, or what the physical infrastructure running it looks like. We believe that you should trust your inbox - that's why we offer open source, privacy-oriented and eco-friendly email.

data.title: Privacy
data.p: Your personal data belongs only to you. We only collect and use the data strictly necessary to run our service, and do not sell or rent this data to anyone. We obviously don't access the content of your emails either - your inbox is in safe hands.

ecodesign.title: Ecodesign
ecodesign.p: We built our code to be efficient and frugal so that it can run on devices with limited capability. Even if email is just a drop in the ocean of our global environmental footprint, we want to transition to a more sustainable and simple digital world.

sovereign.title: Sovereignty
sovereign.p: We believe that digital services should be both sovereign and local - that's why we chose to develop and host our services in France. We think that short distribution channels can also apply to the digital world, and we explore how we can reclaim and democratize the use of digital tools.

hosting.title: Commited hosting
hosting.p: Our services are hosted in an eco-friendly data center in Grenoble, located in a rehabilitated industrial building and powered by renewable energy.

opensource.title: Open source and digital commons
opensource.p: We believe that an open digital world is more trustworthy, more user-friendly and more resilient. Our software is made of open source building blocks and we also contribute to digital commons, in particular digital footprint measurement tools.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.p: We try to be as transparent as possible regarding how our services and our organization work. We want to show you as often as possible what is under the hood and we try to make technical topics easier to understand so that everyone knows what it at stake in the digital world.

ecosystem.title: Our Ecosystem
ecosystem.boavizta: We are members of Boavizta, a collaborative workgroup aiming at providing open source methodologies and tools to measure the environmental footprint of digital technology.
ecosystem.agit: We are also members of Alliance Green IT, a non-profit organization whose goal is to disseminate environmental and social best practices in the digital world.
ecosystem.eolas: Our services are hosted by Eolas, a sustainability-oriented data center located in Grenoble, France.
ecosystem.shift-your-job: Shift Your Job is a platform listing organizations which contribute to the transition to a low-carbon world.
ecosystem.bpi-france: As part of the Innov'Up 'Faisabilité' financing scheme, we received financial support from BPIFrance to develop our project.

roadmap.title: Roadmap
roadmap.p: We have a lot of projects and ideas in the works!

servers.title: Corporate offer
servers.details: Use your own domain name and easily share your documents, contacts and agenda with your collaborators.

client.title: Web client
client.details: An eco-designed webmail with plenty of useful features to make inbox management less time- and energy-consuming.

company.title: Digital low-tech
company.details: How can digital services and low-tech work together to help us build a sustainable future? We are trying to explore this question as we build our services.

webmail.title: Local digital services
webmail.details: What is the equivalent of local food circuits for digital services? We try to reflect upon what a local, decentralized and convivial digital world would look like.

newsletter.disclaimer: Your email address will only be used to send you occasional information about our projects. No spam, no unwanted circulation of your data either.

privacy.caption: An email that respects your data

offercontent.title: What exactly does your offer include?
offercontent.p: By subscribing to the above offer, you will get:

list.address: An email address of your choice on the iroco.co or iroco.io domain name;
list.mailbox: An email box associated with this address containing 5Go-storage space (which corresponds, in order of magnitude, to 100,000 simple emails of 50KB each or 5,000 emails each having 1MB attachment);
list.aliases: 50 aliases, i.e. secondary e-mail addresses composed on the basis of your main address. Messages sent to these aliases will arrive in your primary inbox. You can use aliases, for example, to register for a service without revealing your main address, to communicate with a different address for each type of interlocutor (family, professional relations, friends, etc.) or for all the uses you wish.
list.contact-calendar: The possibility of managing your contacts and calendar.

offercontent.nowebmail: For the moment, our offer does not include webmail (yet): you will therefore have to configure an email client, that is to say an existing tool for managing your emails (Thunderbird for example, but there are many others) in order to receive your emails. If needed, you can consult
offercontent.configurationquestion: the question about how to configure your email client
offercontent.soon: We are working on the development of our eco-designed webmail and hope to soon be able to put it in your hands!

freetrial.title: Why have you ended the free one-month trial?
freetrial.p: We added this feature to allow users to test our services. Unfortunately, most of the trial period users created mailboxes to send spam or phishing. This meant that we regularly had to shut down the registration service during periods when we couldn't monitor the servers (nights, weekends, holidays), or deploy monitoring and security mechanisms that were costly in terms of time and energy.

initial-payment.title: Why an upfront payment on top of the monthly subscription?
initial-payment.p: Groups of malicious people could use our platform to send spam or phishing e-mails by taking multiple accounts (case proven in the past). Payment at the beginning of the month enables us to carry out an initial bank check to verify the non-abusive intention of using our service.

offer.title: Is your offer non-binding?
offer.p: Yes: you can cancel your subscription at any time. There is no minimum commitment period.

data.title: What happens to our data?
data.personal: To be more exact, we are obliged to collect certain personal data when you register, but we undertake not to transmit or sell this data to third parties outside the circumstances strictly necessary for the proper functioning of our service. Unlike other digital service providers, our business model is not based on selling or using your personal data for advertising purposes - that's why our service is chargeable.
data.access: Of course, we do not access to the content of your emails either: you can be sure that your data stored on our servers will remain confidential.
data.detail: In detail, here is the personal data that we collect when you register:

provider.collect: Via our payment provider (the company GoCardless), we collect your

also.collect: Our payment service provider also collects your
also.noaccess: (IBAN), but we don't have access to it.

last.store: Finally, we of course store the
last.iroco: that you created at Iroco, as well as the associated
last.pass: . We also store your password in
last.noaccess: : we therefore do not have clear access to it.

advertisements.title: Will I get any ads using Iroco?
advertisements.p: None. Unlike many free email providers, we don't display ads - not on our site, not on our app, not in your mailbox. This choice is in line with our business model: we prefer to offer our services at a modest cost rather than pay ourselves by selling our users' personal data and privacy to the highest bidder.

ecofriendlyservice.title: Why do you claim your service is green?
ecofriendlyservice.behind: Behind the functioning of an email service, there are many things that we do not always see: lines of code that ensure the routing of messages and the management of your mailbox, physical servers that host applications and data, the computer or the smartphone that you use to check your mailbox and write your mails... We try to work on each of these aspects to offer you a service that saves resources.
ecofriendlyservice.detail: In detail, here is what we do:

list.ecoresponsibility: Our servers are hosted by a service provider committed to an eco-responsible approach.

ecoconception.frugalapps: We eco-design our code in order to develop lean applications, capable of running on devices with limited resources. If you are interested by this (and you are a bit of a geek), you can consult
ecoconception.overview: for an overview of our work.

list.ecodesign: We work towards the design of our interfaces to offer you a pleasant, accessible but also ressource-efficient user experience.

impact.numeric: If you are interested in the environmental impacts of digital technology, you can, for example, take part in a workshop by
impact.question: on the subject.

ecofriendlyservice.print: Email usage is still a drop in the ocean of our environmental footprint ... so feel free to explore the many other ways we can improve that footprint!

opensource.title: What does open source email mean?
opensource.p: The term open source refers to a number of features related to the accessibility of the source code we use to run our services. In particular, it means that our source code is freely accessible to anyone who wishes to consult it: this is a guarantee of transparency on our part, and it ensures that our services work as we say they will. Offering open source services is also part of the philosophy of the digital commons: we use these commons (for example the Cyrus email server, developed for years by the open source community) and we also contribute to them by publishing the source code that we develop and that can thus be reused by those who need it.

location.title: Where are your servers located?
location.p: Our services are hosted in a data center located in Grenoble, France and operated by Eolas, a French company. The data center is secure, ISO27001 certified and committed to an eco-responsible approach. The data on our servers is subject to French regulations, particularly concerning the protection of privacy.

paidservice.title: There are plenty of services that offer a mailbox for free, why is yours chargeable?
paidservice.others: Truly free services are very rare, and mailboxes are no exception. Some providers do offer you an apparently free mailbox… but they are compensated for selling or using your personal data, such as advertising targeting purposes for example. Other providers combine an email service with another paid service: this is the case of Internet service providers, which often offer email addresses included in a paid Internet subscription.
paidservice.iroco: At Iroco, we offer a transparent service: the cost of your subscription is used to finance the functioning of our email service. We only collect personal data that is essential for this service to operate effectively and we do not use it for purposes other than expected.

subscription.title: What is the subscription amount used for?
subscription.emailservice: To make an email service work, you need several things: servers to host applications and data, people to develop and maintain applications, a few third-party services that we have chosen to entrust to service providers ...
subscription.detail: In detail, here is the use of the subscription amount paid by our users:

list.taxes: A little less than 16% (i.e. 20% of the amount excluding taxes) of this amount goes to the tax authorities in the form of VAT: the services offered by Iroco are subject to the standard rate of VAT of 20%, like most goods and services.
list.fee: Our payment provider charges a commission of around 7% on the subscription amount.
list.deployment: Nearly 48% of the subscription is used to cover our hosting costs, i.e. the physical servers on which applications and data are stored.
list.rest: The rest is used to pay our other costs and to compensate the Iroco team.

chart.title: Breakdown of service costs for Iroco

security.title: Are your services secure?
security.p: Our service is hosted under Linux/Debian operating system with regularly updated software packages. Linux/Debian is one of the most reliable open source operating systems, and we follow the recommendations of the maintainers. Our email and web servers are accessible only through TLS secured connections. Moreover, we use intrusion detectors such as fail2ban, as well as Amavis (fight against spam, viruses and malware), SpamAssassin (fight against spam) and ClamAV (fight against spam and viruses). Our services are therefore fully compliant with current security standards.

withdrawal.title: When will the subscription amount be debited?
withdrawal.p: When you register, the subscription is debited the day after you register. The amount of the subscription is then withdrawn every month, the day after the anniversary date of your registration. In the event of termination, your subscription will end at the end of the current month.

team.title: Who is behind Iroco ?
team.p: Behind Iroco, there is a small independent team passionate about eco-design, open source and user-friendly and desirable digital. To learn more about us, you can find us on our LinkedIn page.

account.title: How do I create an account?
account.p: You can create a free account in a very simple way by clicking here. You will be asked to create an email address of your choice and a password.

emailsyntax.introduction: Email has two parts: the local part (before arobase) that you can choose and the domain that is either iroco.co, either iroco.io.
emailsyntax.local-part: The local part is quite open (uppercase, lowercase, numbers, accentuated characters, symbols). Two patterns won't be valid: last character as dot, and two dots (..).

webmail.title: Do you propose a webmail to consult our mailbox?
webmail.p: Not yet. We are working on creating an eco-designed webmail, but it is an important project that will take some time to materialize. In the meantime, why not use an open source mail client like Thunderbird for example?

invalid.title: I can't access my account
invalid.p: If you are unable to access your Iroco account, first make sure you are using the correct email address and password. If you have forgotten your password, select 'Forgot your password?' at login and use the reset code provided to you at registration to fill in the fields indicated. If you signed up for our free trial and did not upgrade to a paid plan before the end of the trial period, your account has been automatically deactivated and you will no longer be able to access it. If your account is active and you still can't access it, you can contact us by email at support@iroco.fr or on one of our social networks.

tor.title: Why I have this error: "We do not authorise registration with a TOR address"?
tor.p:
The privacy of our users is one of our commitments. However, we have been confronted with abuses of our service by spam/phishing organisations. The impact is as follows:
  • The recipients' mail servers receive a large volume of fraudulent messages;
  • The recipients of these messages are defrauded;
  • Third-party servers lower the trust rating of Iroco servers;
  • Legitimate Iroco users can no longer send messages to these third-party servers. These blockages can last several weeks.
To avoid these inconveniences, we have deactivated registration with TOR.

domainname.title: Is it possible to use a custom domain name?
domainname.p: This will be possible very soon! For the moment, we only offer the domain names iroco.io and iroco.co, but we are working on the integration of custom domain names to allow you to use your own domain name with our services. This feature should be available in a few weeks.
